org.activebpel.rt.util
Class AeMessageFormatter

java.lang.Object
  org.activebpel.rt.util.AeMessageFormatter
Direct Known Subclasses:
AeEngineEventFormatter
public abstract class AeMessageFormatter
extends java.lang.Object

This abstract base forms the foundation of indexed, formatted output, which facilitates management of the format strings as localizable resources.

A list of argument values is managed at this level and, when the client requests, those arguments are formatted using a format string that is chosen by a subclass-defined key and map.

Subclasses maintain a (usu. static) HashMap of key / IDs to message format strings, as well as a list of argument indices that correspond to the set of format arguments being used.

Method Detail

getFormatMap

public abstract java.util.HashMap getFormatMap()
Override to populate the format map. This method should initialize a static map the first time it is called. The map is maintained at the subclass level, rather than here, so that different subclasses can maintain different format mappings simultaneously, e.g., a Simulator can be running in one editor page, with a set of simulator message formats, while a Live Debugger can be running in another page using a (different) set of debugger message formats.

getFormatString

public abstract java.lang.String getFormatString(java.lang.String aKey)
Implementors will provide the format string accessor applicable to their environment. If no format string is mapped to the specified key, then the key itself is returned (not null, not an empty string).

Parameters:
aKey - The key that identifies the desired format string.
Returns:
String The corresponding format string, or aKey if not found.

getResourceString

public abstract java.lang.String getResourceString(java.lang.String aKey)
Implementors will provide a resource string accessor applicable to their environment. If no resource string is mapped to the specified key, then the key itself is returned (not null, not an empty string).

Parameters:
aKey - The key that identifies the desired resource string.
Returns:
String The corresponding resource string, or aKey if not found.

getMaxArgs

public abstract int getMaxArgs()
Define the maximum number of arguments made available for formatting. This will be specified by subclasses.

Returns:
int

populateMap

public void populateMap(java.lang.String aPropertyRoot)
Use the plugin.properties property root to cycle through all format definitions for that group and add the formats to the map.

Lists of Message Formatting strings are defined in plugin.properties as:

<propertyRoot>.n=m
<propertyRoot>.ID.m=<format string>

e.g., for a <propertyRoot> of MessageFormatting.Debug.Event:

MessageFormatting.Debug.Event.0=1004
MessageFormatting.Debug.Event.ID.1004=Link {8}: status is {5} [{4}]

In the above case, '1004' should correspond to a message format or event ID in the client environment. This is the value that will be used to identify the format string later, in AeMessageFormatter.format( int ). 'n' values should be sequential, starting with 0
'm' values should be integers, and must correspond to IDs for which format strings are defined by the subclass.

Parameters:
aPropertyRoot - The base key string for the message format group.

mapFormatToID

protected void mapFormatToID(int aID,
                             java.lang.String aFormat)
Base helper to map an ID to a message format string.

aID - The ID to use as a key.
